verses.verse: “Also you shall say to them: ‘Whatever man of the house of Israel, or of the strangers who dwell among you, (Lev. 1:2, 3; 18:26) who offers a burnt offering or sacrifice,
and does not (Lev. 14:23) bring it to the door of the tabernacle of meeting, to offer it to the LORD, that man shall be cut off from among his people.

(Gen. 9:4; Lev. 3:17; 7:26, 27; Deut. 12:16, 23-25; 15:23; 1 Sam. 14:33) ‘And whatever man of the house of Israel, or of the strangers who dwell among you, who eats any blood, (Lev. 20:3, 5, 6) I will set My face against that person who eats blood, and will cut him off from among his people.

For the (Gen. 9:4; Lev. 17:14) life of the flesh is in the blood, and I have given it to you upon the altar ((Matt. 26:28; Rom. 3:25; Eph. 1:7; Col. 1:14, 20; 1 Pet. 1:2; 1 John 1:7)) to make atonement for your souls; for ((Heb. 9:22)) it is the blood that makes atonement for the soul.’
Therefore I said to the children of Israel, ‘No one among you shall eat blood, nor shall any stranger who dwells among you eat blood.’

“Whatever man of the children of Israel, or of the strangers who dwell among you, who (Lev. 7:26) hunts and catches any animal or bird that may be eaten, he shall (Deut. 12:16, 24) pour out its blood and (Ezek. 24:7) cover it with dust;

(Gen. 9:4; Lev. 17:11; Deut. 12:23) for it is the life of all flesh. Its blood sustains its life. Therefore I said to the children of Israel, ‘You shall not eat the blood of any flesh, for the life of all flesh is its blood. Whoever eats it shall be cut off.’

(Ex. 22:31; Lev. 7:24; 22:8; Deut. 14:21; Ezek. 4:14; 44:31) “And every person who eats what died naturally or what was torn by beasts, whether he is a native of your own country or a stranger, (Lev. 11:25) he shall both wash his clothes and (Lev. 15:5) bathe in water, and be unclean until evening. Then he shall be clean.
But if he does not wash them or bathe his body, then (Lev. 5:1) he shall bear his guilt.”
Laws of Sexual Morality Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
“Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: (Ex. 6:7; Lev. 11:44, 45; 19:3; Ezek. 20:5, 7, 19, 20) ‘I am the LORD your God.

(Josh. 24:14; Ezek. 20:7, 8) According to the doings of the land of Egypt, where you dwelt, you shall not do; and (Ex. 23:24; Lev. 18:24-30; 20:23; Deut. 12:30, 31) according to the doings of the land of Canaan, where I am bringing you, you shall not do; nor shall you walk in their ordinances.
(Ezek. 20:19) You shall observe My judgments and keep My ordinances, to walk in them: I am the LORD your God.
You shall therefore keep My statutes and My judgments, which if a man does, he shall live by them: I am the LORD.
‘None of you shall approach anyone who is near of kin to him, to uncover his nakedness: I am the LORD.
The nakedness of your father or the nakedness of your mother you shall not uncover. She is your mother; you shall not uncover her nakedness.
The nakedness of your (Gen. 35:22) father’s wife you shall not uncover; it is your father’s nakedness.
(Lev. 18:11; 20:17; Deut. 27:22) The nakedness of your sister, the daughter of your father, or the daughter of your mother, whether born at home or elsewhere, their nakedness you shall not uncover.
The nakedness of your son’s daughter or your daughter’s daughter, their nakedness you shall not uncover; for theirs is your own nakedness.
The nakedness of your father’s wife’s daughter, begotten by your father—she is your sister—you shall not uncover her nakedness.
(Lev. 20:19) You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father’s sister; she is near of kin to your father.
You shall not uncover the nakedness of your mother’s sister, for she is near of kin to your mother.
(Lev. 20:20) You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father’s brother. You shall not approach his wife; she is your aunt.
You shall not uncover the nakedness of your daughter-in-law—she is your son’s wife—you shall not uncover her nakedness.
You shall not uncover the nakedness of your brother’s wife; it is your brother’s nakedness.

You shall not uncover the nakedness of a woman and her (Lev. 20:14) daughter, nor shall you take her son’s daughter or her daughter’s daughter, to uncover her nakedness. They are near of kin to her. It is wickedness.
Nor shall you take a woman (1 Sam. 1:6, 8) as a rival to her sister, to uncover her nakedness while the other is alive.
‘Also you shall not approach a woman to uncover her nakedness as (Ezek. 18:6) long as she is in her (Lev. 15:24; 20:18) customary impurity.
((Prov. 6:25-33)) Moreover you shall not lie carnally with your (Ex. 20:14; Lev. 20:10; (Matt. 5:27, 28; 1 Cor. 6:9; Heb. 13:4)) neighbor’s wife, to defile yourself with her.

And you shall not let any of your descendants (Lev. 20:2-5; Deut. 12:31) pass through (2 Kin. 16:3) the fire to (1 Kin. 11:7, 33; Acts 7:43) Molech, nor shall you profane the name of your God: I am the LORD.
